app.title: Explore your Spotify streaming history
app.subtitle: Everything stays in your browser, no data is sent to a server.

popup.recoveryMessage: There is existing data in your browser. Do you want to load it?

oneHitWonders.subtitle: Artists you only listened to once (well, one unique track)

fileImport.hint: Select a ZIP archive (my_spotify_data.zip) or JSON file(s) (Streaming_History_Audio_YYYY.json).
fileImport.tutorialTitle: How to Get Your Spotify Data
fileImport.tutorialStep3: Request data and wait for Spotify to email you
fileImport.tutorialStep4: Import the ZIP file from the mail here
fileImport.errorNoData: No valid data found. Imported files must be JSON files starting with "Streaming_History_Audio_" or ZIP archives containing them. Ignored {{count}} file(s)/entry(s).
fileImport.errorProcessing: Error processing files. Please try again.
fileImport.mobileWarning: Note: Processing large datasets on mobile devices may cause performance issues. If you experience problems, please try again on a desktop computer.

questions.question: What data does my Extended Streaming History contain?
questions.answer: Your Extended Streaming History contains detailed information about every single track you've played. For each of the tens of thousands of data points, it records the date and time, the song name, artist, and album. It also includes exactly how long you listened (in milliseconds!), which device you used, your location (country), and even specific details like whether you shuffled, skipped the song, or if you were listening offline. It also tracks why the song started (like clicking a row) or ended (like hitting next).

questions.question: Is my data safe?
questions.answer: Absolutely. This app runs entirely in your browser. Your files are never imported to any server. You can even disconnect your internet after loading the page and it will still work!

questions.question: Why is my data still there even if I reload the page?
questions.answer: Your data is stored directly in your browser. This is like a small, personal storage space just for this website. That's why your data remains even if you close the page and open it again later. You can delete it using the "Import Different File" button.

questions.question: Why do I need the "Extended" history?
questions.answer: The standard "Account Data" download only includes the last year of listening history and lacks detailed information like "skipped", "reason_start", and "platform". The "Extended Streaming History" covers your entire account lifetime and includes all these rich details.

reasonStartTracks.noData: No tracks found matching the criteria

footer.privacy: No personal data is collected from your device or sent to a server.

miniplayer.title: Preview
miniplayer.consentText: By clicking on [Load player], the Spotify player will be loaded and personal data (e.g., your IP address) will be transmitted to Spotify. Further information can be found in the privacy policy.

general.title: 2. General Data Processing
general.localProcessing: This web application processes the entered data exclusively locally within the user's browser. No storage or transmission of this data to our own servers takes place.
general.hostingData: When accessing the website, technically necessary connection data (e.g., IP address, date and time of access, browser information) is processed by the hosting provider to ensure the website is delivered.
general.legalBasis: Legal basis: Article 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in the technical provision of the website).

spotify.title: 3. Integration of Spotify
spotify.description: This website may embed a player provided by Spotify.
spotify.loadCondition: The player is only loaded once the user actively opens it.
spotify.dataTransfer: When loading the player, a connection to Spotify servers is established. In the process, personal data (e.g., IP address, device and browser information, and potentially cookies) may be transmitted to Spotify.
spotify.responsibility: Data processing is carried out under Spotify’s own responsibility.
spotify.moreInfo: Further information can be found in Spotify’s privacy policy:
spotify.legalBasis: Legal basis: Article 6(1)(a) GDPR (consent given by active interaction).
spotify.thirdCountry: It cannot be ruled out that data may be transferred to third countries (e.g., the United States).

rights.title: 4. Data Subject Rights
rights.description: Users have the right to access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, and data portability in accordance with Articles 15–20 GDPR.
rights.complaint: Furthermore, users have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.
